{"step_by_step_thinking": "Oil Red O is a dye used for staining of neutral triglycerides and lipids. The staining has to be performed on fresh samples, as alcohol fixation removes most lipids. This suggests that Oil Red O is not used for alcohol fixed specimens. There is no information in the documents about Oil Red O being used for glutaraldehyde or formalin fixed specimens. However, multiple documents mention that Oil Red O is used for staining on frozen sections.", "answer_choice": "D. Frozen specimen"}
